These classes and interfaces that support the definition and use of "random - * generators", a term that is meant to cover what have traditionally been - * called "random number generators" as well as generators of other sorts of - * randomly chosen values, and also to cover not only deterministic - * (pseudorandom) algorithms but also generators of values that use some "truly - * random" physical source (perhaps making use of thermal noise, for example, or - * quantum-mechanical effects). + *

These classes and interfaces support the definition and use of "random + * generators", a term covering what have traditionally been called "random + * number generators" as well as generators of other sorts of randomly chosen + * values (eg. booleans).
